marketNews.title: BEI Implements Revision of FCA, Preparing to Release Short Sell
marketNews.content: Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) officially implemented the revision of the criteria for the special monitoring board (full call auction) on Friday, 21 June 2024. As previously discussed in Stockbit Snips, the revised criteria will tighten the conditions for a stock to be placed on the FCA and provide flexibility for a stock to exit the FCA. In line with the implementation of the revision, six stocks were removed from the special monitoring board on Friday, one of which was Barito Renewable Energy (BREN). Under the previous rule, BREN – which was subject to criterion number 10 on the special monitoring board – could only be traded regularly after 30 calendar days since its inclusion on 29 May 2024. However, because the new criterion number 10 requires only a 7‑trading‑day duration for a stock to exit the special monitoring board, BREN is now allowed to trade regularly and is no longer subject to full call auction. The revision was generally received positively by market participants, with the stocks removed from the special monitoring board moving higher in today’s trading, except those under suspension. In addition to the FCA criteria revision, BEI is preparing to launch a short‑sell trading mechanism, with a target implementation no later than October 2024. As of 14 June 2024, BEI has designated 116 stocks eligible for short‑sell trading, the full list of which can be accessed via the provided link. Short‑sell is a trading mechanism where an investor borrows shares from a broker and sells them on the market, hoping the price will fall. After the price declines, the investor repurchases the shares at a lower price and returns them to the broker, profiting from the price difference. Key takeaway: The revision of the FCA criteria and the implementation of short‑sell have the potential to increase stock transaction liquidity. The extent of investor access to short‑sell will depend on the final mechanism and the exchange’s rules and requirements for its members, which will determine the level of interest among members to engage in short‑sell.

marketNews.title: Rumor CAMP Targeted by Bahrain Investment Manager
marketNews.content:
- CAMP: DealStreetAsia reported that Bahrain‑based investment manager Investcorp plans to purchase a majority stake in Campina Ice Cream Industry from its controller Sabana Prawirawidjaja. Sabana currently holds 83.94% of CAMP shares. No further details on the transaction have been disclosed, and CAMP has not commented on the issue.
- SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa reported the sale of industrial land covering 121 hectares during the first five months of 2024, representing 65.8% of the 2024 target of 184 hectares. Of this, 108 hectares came from Subang Smartpolitan, and the remainder from Suryacipta City of Industry Karawang. Regarding land sale prices, SSIA noted that there was no increase in land prices in either industrial area compared to 2023.
- UNVR: Unilever Indonesia will distribute a final dividend for fiscal year 2023 amounting to 2.93 trillion rupiah or 77 rupiah per share. The dividend is not yet ex‑dividend, and payment must be made no later than 18 July 2024. Based on UNVR’s share price on Friday (21/6) at 2,990 rupiah per share, the implied final dividend yield is 2.6%. Previously, UNVR also distributed an interim dividend of 2.4 trillion rupiah or 63 rupiah per share in December 2023, resulting in a total dividend for FY 2023 equal to a 111.25% dividend payout ratio.
- BREN: Barito Renewable Energy announced that it has injected capital of 497.4 billion rupiah into its subsidiary PT Barito Wind Energy (BWE) by acquiring all newly issued shares. The funds have been used by BWE amounting to 29 million US dollars to repay the Tranche B facility of Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) on 14 June 2024. BWE owns the Sidrap 75 MW wind power plant. Previously, BWE completed the acquisition of the Sidrap geothermal power plant valued at 102.2 million US dollars with financing support from BBNI.
- WINS: Wintermar Offshore Marine reported a fleet utilization rate of 68% during the first five months of 2024, stable compared with the previous year. Compared with FY23, the average charter rate during the first five months of 2024 grew by 23.1% for high‑tier vessels and 14.5% for mid‑tier vessels. WINS also revised its 2024 capex allocation upward from 20 million US dollars to 35 million US dollars to meet higher demand driven by increased offshore investment and limited vessel supply. From that allocation, WINS has realized capex of 13.9 million US dollars.
- BSDE: The controller of Bumi Serpong Damai, PT Paraga Artamida, purchased approximately 12.3 million shares of BSDE at an average price of 943.36 rupiah per share on 12 June 2024. The total transaction value reached about 11.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Paraga Artamida’s ownership in BSDE increased from 40.1% to 40.15%.
- Bappenas: The head of the National Development Planning Agency (Bappenas), Suharso Monoarfa, said that 46% of social assistance recipients are incorrectly targeted due to exclusion and inclusion errors, resulting in non‑eligible households receiving aid while eligible poor households are left out.
- Luhut: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated that Indonesia has agreed with several other countries to waive export duties on raw materials for electric‑vehicle batteries to secure nickel downstream markets amid global trade protectionism.
- Counterpoint Research: The firm found that electric‑vehicle sales in Southeast Asia more than doubled year‑on‑year in Q1 2024, led by BYD and VinFast, while conventional vehicle sales fell 7% YoY.
- China Coal Production: Coal output in China fell by 54 million tonnes (‑3% YoY) to 1.858 million tonnes in the first five months of 2024. The decline was offset by a 13% YoY increase in imported coal, up 23 million tonnes.
- KLBF: Kalbe Farma, through its subsidiary PT Bifarma Adiluhung, announced a partnership with South Korean biotechnology company GC Cell to develop cell‑therapy business. The strategic partnership aims to facilitate the entry of Immuncell‑LC in Indonesia, an innovative cell therapy for liver cancer surgery, and includes technology transfer and joint development of a Natural Killer (NK) Cells pipeline.
- KAEF: The President Director of Kimia Farma said the company plans to close five of its ten factories within the next five years to improve efficiency, citing weak financial health and low plant utilization, which peaks at only 40%.
